required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Risk for Radiographic and Clinical Nonunion in Patients With Previous Bisphosphonates Therapy.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Risk for Radiographic and Clinical Nonunion in Patients With Previous Bisphosphonates Therapy.

brief_summary.textblock: Dose and duration of bisphosphonate therapy will increase the likelihood that patients experience delayed healing of non-union fractures.

detailed_description.textblock: We intend to review the UWHealth patient database to identify individuals with delayed or nonunion fractures. Subsequently, we will collect associated medical information related to fractures such as age of osteoporosis diagnosis, BMI, previous bisphosphonate treatment, type and location of fracture, time to complete union, other treatment needed for nonunion etc. With this information, we will evaluate the risk of delayed and nonunion fractures in patients previously receiving bisphosphonate treatment compared to a normal population. We also will investigate other potential causes of delayed or nonunion fractures in this population.

clinical_study.why_stopped: It was a project initiated by a trainee but did not progress to subject accrual.

primary_outcome.measure: The number of patients with delayed healing or non-union fractures with prior bisphosphonate use
primary_outcome.description: This variable will be generated by reviewing diagnosis codes from patients seen at the University of Wisconsin Hospital and Clinics during the time period identified above.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of patient variables (demographic or medical history) related to non-union or delayed healing fractures.
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with non-union or delayed healing fractures obtaining care at the University of Wisconsin Hospital or Clinics will have a medical record review conducted.

arm_group.description: Patients with record of using bisphosphonate medication

study_pop.textblock: Men and women older than 60 years old with delayed or nonunion low trauma fracture beween 01/01/2000 - 12/31/2011.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women older than 60 years old with delayed or nonunion low trauma fracture between 01/01/2000 - 12/31/2011.
Exclusion Criteria:

clinical_study.keyword: osteoporosis, low trauma fracture, non-union fracture, delayed healing fracture, bisphosphonate
